data.title: Unexpected greatness
data.text: We went for a festival & had the greatest time.  Paid for parking on the grass near entrance. Entrance to venue was quick & professional. Vendors everywhere. This venue is amazing.  Has 2 different type stages with a ton of everything in between.  Looks like a small town. Prices are great.  Awesome vibe & the friendliest people.  Looking forward to going back!!!

data.title: C.C. Motorcycle Rally
data.text: Loved the new venue for this years event. Wide open spaces, the layout was great. Grassy areas to relax in, more than large band stage! Staff for the event were very helpful! LAst years events have been held at the Bank Center near the bay. This was a refreshing change. This venue is a keeper.

data.title: Great Venue Tainted by Open Drug Use
data.text: I went to Concrete Street Saturday to see Bricks in the Wall which is a Pink Floyd tribute bad. This place is huge. They can hold outdoor concerts on an arena sized stage or hold smaller concerts under the covered area they have. This was the case for this show. The band was fantastic by the way. The set up here at Concrete Street is really good. Plenty of places to get food and drinks so there never seemed to be any long lines. I saw many people here with children so I found the open use of pot by quite a few groups to be really bad. Not a good thing to expose your children to. I saw Concrete Street staff walk right past people smoking weed and not even bat an eyelash. I guess this is expectable behavior here because the Corpus Christi Police that were walking around did not do anything about it either. The management should really do something about this as it casts a bad light on a great place.

data.title: KILLER VENUE
data.text: Took 3 teens to see Panic at the Disco and it was awesome.  General admission tickets and were practically front row.  Sound was awesome.  Wish I lived closer so I could see more shows there.  Parking was a little far away but very organized.  Clean facilities.

data.title: Panic! at the Disco and Weezer.
data.text: Great place to watch a show. Great backdrops ans acoustics were great. Concert goers were wonderful as well.

data.title: Cool Place for a Show
data.text: Went to see Lamb of God and Anthrax in the winter. The show was a "Pavilion Show" which meant they used the smaller, covered area for the show. They have a full sized "festival sized" area on the premises for bigger shows. Needless to say we could get as close as we wanted in the general admission section, the beer lines were somewhat long, but far and away the most appealing thing was that parking was only $10 for a spot across the street. Rock On!!

data.title: Great times
data.text: This is an old venue that has some good management and offers quality shows at a very affordable price. The parking is dicey but the shows are old time cool

data.title: Great concert venue!
data.text: Saw 3 Doors Down concert 03July15.  Great show.  This is a good concert venue.  Great views of the stage, love the grassy hillside, comfortable and trees provide some shade from the South Texas sun.  The lot is divided into a standing area (no chairs) and an area where you can bring chairs.  Plenty of food and drink vendors, plenty of shaded areas, plenty of free parking and getting in and out of the area was relatively quick and painless.  This is far better than any stadium or Arena concerts I've been to; Plenty of restrooms so there was no line.  Drinks are quite pricey ($6.95 for 16 oz beer; $3.50 for soda and water) so I suggest a primer before entering the venue!  Roadies had sets removed and set up between bands very quickly.  You can rent chairs; we just brought a tarp and sat on the grass

data.title: Ok Outdoor Venu
data.text: Been here couple times outdoor venue been to larger outdoor stage and the open side barn stage. Largest complaint is have to stand way to much no seating even when there should be some when dining at inside facility.

data.title: Randy Rogers Band
data.text: Comfortable on the grass hill and drank. Drinks were way over priced but hey it's at a concert, Beer 16oz- $6.25!  But had an amazing time! unforgettable memories!

data.title: Good venue & prices
data.text: Had fun here. But too high on the sodas. Too small of a venue but other than that, it's hard to find parking.

data.title: Great concerts, hard to find parking.
data.text: Went and saw seether it was really hot. But not Concretes fault. Show was awesome! Drinks are ridiculously expensive so be prepared or have a few before coming. Looking forward to Korn in Nov and cooler weather.

data.title: Pretty nice place but I`ve heard better acoustics
data.text: I have been to several concerts there.   I like it pretty well but  I have heard better acoustics at other venues.   Sometimes they `ll have a concert at one of their smaller stages.   It is all outdoors.

data.title: this place ROX !
data.text:
Ok, this is the place for live music in south texas, the live shows are always good I've been to a lot of shows here and was never disappointed. Big bands play here, Korn Disturbed Godsmack Staind Bush Chevelle.. in a small venue, and that equals FUN. This old rocker has seen shows from LA to Syracuse to Jacksonville and my hometown of Houston, this place is just as good or better for concerts than anywhere else I've been, Woodlands, etc. 
Fun facts:  Find out (just before the show call the box office) if the show is outside or in the pavilion, if it's outside bring a small blanket to sit on you'll be glad you brought it. If you bring a camera, again.. call just before the show and make sure they didn't change their minds about allowing non-detachable lens camera's inside the show.. it's a long walk back to your car.. lol drink a few beers before ya go if you're on a low budget, they're (all concert halls are) proud of the alcohol they sell, beer's are 5.50 ea but don't let that stop ya, live shows here are kick*ss !!
